motion: Governments should prohibit data brokers from selling precise location data without explicit opt-in consent.
Manufacturers should be legally required to provide parts, tools, and manuals to enable right-to-repair at fair prices.
End-to-end encryption should be protected by law, even when it prevents lawful access to private messages.
Social media platforms should be required to offer a chronological feed as the default option.
Large online platforms should be required to provide secure data portability and interoperability with competing services.
Deploying AI systems in policing, lending, or hiring should require a government license.
Political advertisers should be banned from using microtargeting based on personal data.
AI-generated content used in political campaigning should be clearly watermarked and traceable.
Broadband internet should be regulated as a public utility.
Copyright terms should be reduced to 25 years after publication.
Central banks should issue a retail digital currency for everyday public use.
Governments should impose a financial transaction tax on stock trades.
Countries should adopt ranked-choice voting in national elections.
Voting should be compulsory, with a small fine for non-participation.
Partisan gerrymandering should be outlawed by requiring independent redistricting commissions.
The voting age should be lowered to 16 for national elections.
Campaigns for national office should be limited by law to a maximum of 10 weeks.
Paid political advertising on broadcast television should be banned.
Governments should replace most child-related welfare programs with a universal child allowance.
A progressive net wealth tax should be introduced on fortunes above a high threshold.
Inheritance taxes should be substantially increased to reduce intergenerational inequality.
Large corporations should be required to include worker representatives on their boards.
Share buybacks should be taxed at the same effective rate as dividends.
The legal standard full-time workweek should be reduced to 32 hours without pay cuts.
Employers should be legally required to disclose salary ranges in job postings.
Non-compete agreements should be banned for most workers.
Gig platforms should provide portable benefits proportional to hours worked.
Governments should guarantee at least 12 weeks of paid family leave.
Public universities should be tuition-free for in-state students.
Universities should admit students by lottery among applicants who meet clear academic thresholds.
Standardized tests should be required for competitive university admissions.
High schools should require a year-long financial literacy course for graduation.
Schools should require students to store phones in locked pouches during the school day.
Countries should move to opt-out organ donation systems.
Prescription drug prices should be capped using international reference pricing.
Supervised consumption sites should be legalized to reduce overdose deaths.
Health insurers should be required to cover mental health at parity with physical health.
Human germline gene editing should be banned until a global enforceable treaty exists.
A carbon tax with per-capita dividends should be the primary climate policy tool.
New coal power plants should be banned immediately.
Building codes should require net-zero emissions for new buildings by 2030.
Meat and dairy should be taxed based on greenhouse gas footprint.
After 2035, governments should prioritize climate adaptation spending over additional mitigation spending.
Cities should abolish minimum parking requirements for new development.
Single-family-only zoning should be eliminated in high-demand metro areas.
Congestion pricing should be implemented in the centers of major cities.
Governments should launch large-scale public housing construction to stabilize rents.
Drug possession for personal use should be decriminalized and treated as a public health issue.
Cash bail should be abolished for most offenses.
The UN Security Council veto should be limited in cases of mass atrocities.
